Killing Floor is without a doubt one of the best co-op shooters I have ever played. Don't let the 2009 graphics put you off - this game is still fresh and fun several years later. As of 2013, Tripwire Interactive (the developer of KF) is still providing regular content updates that help keep the game interesting.

How is the game itself? As I said before, the graphics are somewhat dated, but not to the point of being ugly. The sound design is fantastic. All of the weapons have a unique look and feel to them. The one commonality between all 40-some weapons is that they are all very satisfying to use. Even though some weapons cost more than others, there really aren't any weapons that are flat-out better than others. Every weapon is meant to fulfill a certain role and cater to different play styles.

As of now, there are seven classes or "perks" in the game. Each perk has its own special abilities and strengths. For example, the Firebug perk gets a incendiary grenades and extra damage with fire-based weapons, while the Medic perk gets healing grenades and more effective heals. No matter what your playstyle is, KF has a perk to accommodate you.

Teamwork is at the core of this game, especially on higher difficulty levels. Generally speaking, if teammates do not support each other, the entire team will fail. The diversity of enemies and map layouts forces teams to be just as diverse. A team that cannot adapt to sudden changes in enemy forces will most likely die horribly.

As you can probably tell by my total play time in this game (365 hours as of this posting) this game has immense replay value. My recommendation to you is to buy this game on sale and play it with some friends. If you enjoy dark, gritty, and intense co-op shooters, you will not be disappointed by Killing Floor.

This old UT2k4 mod has nothing to do with killing floors, you actually kill zombies, do not be misled by the title as I was.
Anyway, I guess it's like Left 4 Dead, except you have to buy guns, so I guess it's like Counter-Strike, except it has classes, so I guess it's like Team Fortress 2, except it doesn't have hats, so I guess it's like DOTA 2, except it's not a MOBA, so I guess I don't know what this game is about after all. This is one of my most played games to date. It can be played solo but the fun is when you play with others online as your survival depends on team work in any difficulty above beginner. The guns are sound and feel powerful bits of zombie/mutant fly which never gets old. Lots of players online so the online community is alive and well. Also there is lots of fan made downloadable maps, story maps, guns and skin all free of charge from the steam workshop. Killing Floor, It's a game where you other londoners, or a robot, or a chicken, or a robot chicken duke it out against the twisted creations of Horzine Biotech, an ethically corrupt company, whos CEO, Kevin Clamely has gone mad and unleashed hell upon the streets of London, and the surrounding towns and cities.

It's you, your rag-tag bunch of survivors, a Trader, and whatever burning, lacerating, exploding, hole-punching devices you can put between you and the science gone wrong that's coming at you from all sides, with a taste for the flesh on your face.

There are seven classes, referred to as perks for you to choose from:

The Field Medic, whos armour comes cheap, lasts a lot longer and runs around fast as shit, your role is to keep everyone else standing, but with the right setup, you become a powerful offensive unit as well.

The Support specialist, who can carry more weight, and is lethal with a shotgun of any kind, the support specialist can also weld doors quicker and carry a lot more grenades than most other classes

The Sharpshooter, I don't think there's much to say here, Pistols, Rifles, Crossbows and Headshots, We all know someone who's obsessed with sniping, get that bastard to do some sniping for you.

The Commando, who can see the cloaked enemies as clear as day, as well as reload faster than anybody else, The commando makes best use of assault rifles, and is pretty good with many other weapons too.

The Berserker, the mad bastard who we all know must kill everything with a Katana, we all know one, and if you don't know one... It's probably you, The Berserker can run quickly, and is lethal with Melee weapons, The Berserker also cannot be grabbed by clots, which is very handy in a pinch.

The Firebug, is the arsonist of the group, if it catches fire, it dies of horrible burns, and lets face it, there's nothing like the smell of napalm and burning flesh in a morning, The Firebug also gets damage resistance to fire, which is useful for dealing with Husks

The Demolitions Expert, fire, bullets and blades are fine, but blowing something the fuck up is a hell of a lot more entertaining, people who take on the demolitions perk can carry more grenades, and get more damage out of all explosive weapons, they also get some damage resistance to explosives, but that doesn't mean you're invulnerable to them, be careful.

I had to cut this short, fucking limitations, Play it, it's good.

[h1] Первая моя купленная игра в Стим и первая игра в которой нашел друзей из Стим (Украина и РФ). Как были прекрасны те года, до начала полномасштабного путлеровского пиздеца (2014г).[/h1]
Killing Floor выросла из любительского мода UT 2004 в отдельный самодостаточный проект.  Суть Killing Floor заключается в борьбе одного или группы до шести человек против монстров-зомби, которые заполонили улицы и здания Лондона в результате неудачного правительственного эксперимента. Арсенал для истребления клонов-мутантов весьма разнообразен, есть много оружия мили и огнестрела. 6 различных классов в игре, вобщем принцип один чем больше убьешь зомби тем быстрее прокачаешься)  на высокой сложности игра толкает на слаженную работу в команде-без этого не выжить в Killing Floor.

This game is very much like Left 4 Dead but in my opinion better. Taking the L4D formula and going a step further this game has much to offer to fans of the genre. One thing I will say is that its incredibly difficult, but still quite fun! I refuse to go to an easy difficulty but it exists. I haven't yet figured out everything there is in this game. Although playable alone, this game really shines when played with others. So far I'm loving it.

If you ever get bored, hop onto a 5/6 person server. Even if you aren't any good, you'll find satisfaction and enjoyment from seeing zombie heads being blown off.  This reason why you should join a near full server is that very rarely can you survive alone. Its all fun and games until a patriarch teleports in front of you and fires his MINIGUN point blank.

Обзор дополнения Toy Master. Так как эта идиотская игра нее захотела, засчитывать мне время проведённое в ней.

Дополнение для тех кто хочет посмотреть на тупых кукол, которые как сумашедшие ломают ящики? Нахрена им эти ящики? Просто сидите у девочек и они будут в вас играть. Хотя, честно говоря, увидев, что вы идёте с ножами, сразу становится понятно, что девочка или мальчик или кто там в вас играет, просто больной. Кто станет привязывать ножи к игрушкам? Это что весело? Ай спасите помогите на нас идут куколки с нажами и циркулярками, они заберут ящики в которых сидит ТОЧНО ТАКОЙ ЖЕ КУКОЛ большого размера. Хотя если поразмыслить, возможно они идут спасать его. Тогда возникает другой вопрос нахрена команде по борьбе с зомби нужно было красть у маленькой девочки игрушки? Здесь явно, кто то не здоров. Они могли бы не воровать игрушки, а придти к девочке и спросить, какого хера её родиели не смотрят за ней, она ведь ножи и циркулярные пилы к ним привязывают. А они что? Разбросали здоровые кубы по своему замку. Вот просто больные. Аж картины трясутся в страхе, завидев улыбающееся лицо с привязанным ножом в руке. Экзорцист им в помощь, а мне в помощь средство от скукотищи.

DOSH DOSH. GRAB IT WHILE ITS HOT.

Killing floor is a twist on modern zombie games. You have the ability to choose seven perks and each comes with their own pros and cons, and your playstyles tend to revolve around those perks. It may seem hard at first, but as you level your perks up you gain the ability to do things that are amazing, such as make the final boss do a flip off the side of the map.

Killer fun game! The perk system and wider range of weapons makes this wave style  survival game very replayable and relieves any tedium you might expect, with varying ways to splatter a mutant's headstuff all over the place, or turn a crowd of them into a fine cloud of blood mist. Which is just as satisfying the first time as it is the 10000th time.  

Though I do find it is a better time if you indulge in the co-op aspect and drag some friends along to play with you. A little strategy helps in the harder settings.

If you're a completionist, this game also sports over 200 achievements some of which can be done easily in a solo game and others which will definitely take teamwork and lots of elbow grease.

This is the kind of game that I know guys with very thick accents from Europe will come to like a hell of alot. Also, I have to say the gameplay is not only very solid, but the Survival Horror element is there as well. This game has a huge number of followers as well so you are bound to find plenty of servers to find your fit. The fandom is NOT as huge as Team Fortress 2, but big enough that you are going to have a good damn time. The gun handling in this game is some of the best I have ever had and would definitely recommend for you to play it just to exeprience it. Also, word of advice: DON'T SELL OTHER PEOPLES' WEAPONS. EVER.
